newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey sacks military officers in "Islamist purge".
newsitem.headline: Turkey sacks military officers in "Islamist purge".

text.p: Turkey's military announced on Tuesday it had sacked nearly 70 officers and NCOs for discipline problems in what the Turkish press says is a clean out of Islamist officers in the armed forces.

"The lack of discipline and the moral situation of 33 officers and 36 non-commissioned officers was reviewed and it was decided to end their relation with the Turkish armed forces," the military said in a statement after a two-day council meeting.
Turkey's media has said most of the offenders were suspected of having Islamist tendencies. The influential armed forces is one of the country's most secular bodies.
Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan, Turkey's first Islamist leader, was absent from the opening day of the council in a break with tradition but he attended Tuesday's second session.
Erbakan, in coalition with a secularist party, has been ineffective in bringing Islamist policies to bear in areas of public life regarded by the generals as within their remit.
He has gone back on promises to scrap a military deal with Israel and throw out a U.S.-led air force that patrols northern Iraq from a base in Turkey.
